<a id="SyntaxHighlighter"></a>

# SyntaxHighlighter

**Inherits:** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [CodeHighlighter](CodeHighlighter.md), [EditorSyntaxHighlighter](EditorSyntaxHighlighter.md)

Base class for syntax highlighters. Provides syntax highlighting data to a [TextEdit](TextEdit.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Base class for syntax highlighters. Provides syntax highlighting data to a [TextEdit](TextEdit.md). The associated [TextEdit](TextEdit.md) will call into the **SyntaxHighlighter** on an as-needed basis.

\ **Note:** A **SyntaxHighlighter** instance should not be used across multiple [TextEdit](TextEdit.md) nodes.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<a id="SyntaxHighlighter_method_clear_highlighting_cache"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **clear_highlighting_cache**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#SyntaxHighlighter_method_clear_highlighting_cache)

Clears all cached syntax highlighting data.

Then calls overridable method [_clear_highlighting_cache()](SyntaxHighlighter.md#SyntaxHighlighter_private_method__clear_highlighting_cache).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SyntaxHighlighter_method_get_line_syntax_highlighting"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Dictionary](Dictionary.md) **get_line_syntax_highlighting**\ (\ line\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#SyntaxHighlighter_method_get_line_syntax_highlighting)

Returns the syntax highlighting data for the line at index `line`. If the line is not cached, calls [_get_line_syntax_highlighting()](SyntaxHighlighter.md#SyntaxHighlighter_private_method__get_line_syntax_highlighting) first to calculate the data.

Each entry is a column number containing a nested [Dictionary](Dictionary.md). The column number denotes the start of a region, the region will end if another region is found, or at the end of the line. The nested [Dictionary](Dictionary.md) contains the data for that region. Currently only the key ``"color"`` is supported.

\ **Example:** Possible return value. This means columns ``0`` to ``4`` should be red, and columns ``5`` to the end of the line should be green:

```
    {
        0: {
            "color": Color(1, 0, 0)
        },
        5: {
            "color": Color(0, 1, 0)
        }
    }
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TextEdit](TextEdit.md) **get_text_edit**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#SyntaxHighlighter_method_get_text_edit)

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SyntaxHighlighter_method_update_cache"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **update_cache**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#SyntaxHighlighter_method_update_cache)

Clears then updates the **SyntaxHighlighter** caches. Override [_update_cache()](SyntaxHighlighter.md#SyntaxHighlighter_private_method__update_cache) for a callback.

\ **Note:** This is called automatically when the associated [TextEdit](TextEdit.md) node, updates its own cache.
